BOSS: A person who oversees and directs the work of others; a supervisor.
CHERRY: A small fruit, usually red, black or yellow, with a smooth hard seed and a short hard stem.
FRESH: A rush of water, along a river or onto the land; a flood.
MAJOR: A military rank between captain and lieutenant colonel.
PHAT: (originally African American Vernacular English) Excellent; cool; very good.
RADICAL: (historical: 19th-century Britain) A member of the most progressive wing of the Liberal Party; someone favouring social reform (but generally stopping short of socialism).
